name: Portugal
description: Portugal, officially the Portuguese Republic, is a nation located on the Iberian Peninsula in Southwestern Europe. Known for its stunning coastline, historic cities, vibrant culture, and delicious cuisine, Portugal offers a diverse range of experiences. From the rolling hills of the Douro Valley to the dramatic cliffs of the Algarve, Portugal’s geography is as varied as its history.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Portugal is the ninth-largest country in Europe.
quickFacts.detail: This includes mainland Portugal and the Azores and Madeira islands.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Portugal has a population of over 10 million people.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is approximately 112 people per sq km.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Lisbon is the largest city in Portugal.
quickFacts.detail: It's a historic city with a rich maritime past.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: It has distinct dialects influenced by its history.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: Portugal uses the Euro as its currency.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: It's a member of the European Union.

climateData.title: Portuguese Climate
climateData.description: Portugal experiences a Mediterranean climate, characterized by hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. However, there are regional variations due to its diverse geography.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Long, sunny days with high temperatures, especially in the south.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September-November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Pleasant temperatures, with a gradual decrease in rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December-February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Mild winters, particularly in the south, with occasional rainfall.
activities: Skiing in the Serra da Estrela

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March-May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm temperatures and blossoming flowers, creating a beautiful landscape.

naturalWonders.name: Pico Island
naturalWonders.description: Pico Island, the westernmost point of Europe, is dominated by Mount Pico, Portugal’s highest peak. This UNESCO World Heritage site showcases a unique volcanic landscape with dramatic craters and lava flows.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Mount Pico’s summit offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Atlantic Ocean and neighboring islands. The island’s volcanic origins have created a distinctive ecosystem, supporting rare plant and animal species.
viewingTips: Bring warm clothing, even in summer.

naturalWonders.name: Ria Formosa Natural Park
naturalWonders.description: The Ria Formosa Natural Park is a stunning lagoon system located south of Faro, offering a diverse range of habitats and abundant wildlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This protected area is characterized by barrier islands, sandy beaches, salt marshes, and mudflats. It’s a crucial breeding ground for numerous bird species and a popular destination for birdwatching and water sports.
viewingTips: Respect the wildlife and its habitat.

scientificData.WaterSalinity: Variable, ranging from brackish to marine

naturalWonders.name: Douro Valley
naturalWonders.description: The Douro Valley, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is renowned for its terraced vineyards and picturesque river scenery. It's a region of immense beauty and historical significance.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Douro River winds its way through the valley, creating a dramatic landscape of steep slopes covered in vineyards. The region is famous for its Port wine production, and visitors can enjoy wine tasting tours and scenic cruises.
viewingTips: Take a river cruise to admire the vineyards.
Visit a Port wine cellar for a tasting.

ecosystemData.title: Portuguese Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Portugal boasts a diverse range of ecosystems, from Mediterranean forests and coastal wetlands to mountainous regions and volcanic landscapes. These ecosystems support a rich biodiversity and provide essential ecological services.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mediterranean Forests, Woodlands and Scrub
biodiversityCategories.description: These ecosystems dominate much of Portugal, characterized by drought-resistant trees and shrubs.

statistics.details: Includes cork oak, olive trees, and pine trees.
Provides habitat for numerous bird and mammal species.

notableSpecies.name: Cork Oak (Quercus suber)
notableSpecies.significance: Important for cork production and biodiversity.

notableSpecies.name: Iberian Lynx (Lynx pardinus)
notableSpecies.significance: One of the world’s most endangered cats.

biodiversityCategories.name: Atlantic Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Found in the north and northwest of Portugal, these forests are characterized by Atlantic climate and diverse tree species.

statistics.details: Includes beech, oak, and maple trees.
Supports a wide range of plant and animal species.

notableSpecies.name: Black Stork (Ciconia nigra)
notableSpecies.significance: A rare bird species found in Portugal.

notableSpecies.name: Iberian Wolf (Canis lupus signatus)
notableSpecies.significance: An important predator in the ecosystem.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Portugal
activities.description: Portugal offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.description: Explore Portugal’s diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Serra da Estrela Hike
activities.description: Hike through the stunning Serra da Estrela mountain range, Portugal’s highest peak.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, waterproof jacket, water bottle

activities.name: Ria Formosa Coastal Trail
activities.description: Walk along the coastal trails of the Ria Formosa Natural Park.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Atlantic Ocean and the Algarve coast.

activities.name: Surfing in Sagres
activities.description: Learn to surf or improve your skills in Sagres, known for its consistent waves.
safety: Take a lesson from a qualified instructor

activities.name: Kayaking in the Douro Valley
activities.description: Paddle along the Douro River and admire the vineyards from a unique perspective.
